Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning to secure the Yankees' victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer and was named ALCS MVP.
Luke Weaver got the final three outs with Lane Thomas flying out for the last one, which was caught by Soto.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees general manager Brian Cashman expressed satisfaction with the team's position.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone commented on the team's journey and the significance of the win.
Giancarlo Stanton reflected on the team's resilience and the challenges ahead.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt expressed pride in his team's accomplishments despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series and first in 15 years.
The Guardians' season ended under first-year manager Stephen Vogt, extending their title drought since 1948.
Yankees fans chanted 'Re-sign Soto!' during the postgame festivities, indicating his potential high-value contract.
Others: Yankees' LHP Nestor Cortes had another successful live batting practice session and is on track to join the World Series roster.
